title: U.S. CFTC Chief Behnam Reinforces View of Ether as Commodity - CoinDesk
summary: U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) Chairman Behnam has reiterated his view that ether (ETH) is a commodity, expressing concern over Europe's strides in regulating cryptocurrencies. Behnam emphasized the need for the U.S. to "move the ball forward" in regulating digital assets, acknowledging Europe's efforts to establish a comprehensive regulatory framework.

title: ETH deposits and withdrawals available on the Polygon network! - Kraken Blog
summary: Kraken now supports ETH deposits and withdrawals on the Polygon network! 🚀 Deposit ETH to your Kraken account by navigating to Funding > ETH > Polygon. 💰 Learn more about Polygon and how to buy ETH on our Learn Center. Trade with caution, as there are no guarantees for limit or market orders. 💡 Unregulated markets may not provide government compensation or regulatory protection. Tax may be payable on crypto gains. 📈

title: Professor behind EigenLabs gets $50 million funding, promises to upgrade Ethereum network - Fortune
summary: Professor Sreeram Kannan's startup EigenLabs has raised $50 million to improve Ethereum's infrastructure and make it as fast and flexible as centralized networks like Amazon Web Services. EigenLayer, the flagship product, allows developers to choose which nodes run their code, enabling a division of computing labor and faster data inscription capabilities. The funding round was led by Blockchain Capital and includes investors like Coinbase Ventures and Electric Capital. Kannan, a former associate professor at the University of Washington, aims to maximize the surface of innovation and onboard new developers and users to build on EigenLayer.

title: Ethereum Pinned Below $2,000 Despite Network Burning Over 3 Million ETH - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum prices have been unable to break above $2,000 since May 2022, despite the network burning over 3 million ETH through EIP-1559. The burn rate depends on network activity, with transfers between addresses contributing to 266,217.50 ETH being destroyed since August 2021. NFTs have also contributed to ETH burning, with 230,050 ETH being burned through OpenSea. Despite this, proponents are bullish on ETH's deflationary nature and potential for higher prices in the future.

title: Ethereum Co-Founder Has 'Biggest Stake' in VeChain and Qtum - CCN.com
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum co-founder Anthony Di Iorio has revealed that he has the largest stake in Chinese blockchain projects Qtum and VeChain. He believes that these projects have the most potential for success due to the opportunity for wide adoption. Despite China's poor cryptocurrency trading regulations, the government has continued to support blockchain startups through funding. Iorio also emphasized the importance of securing partnerships with reputable companies to commercialize the blockchain at scale. Additionally, he noted that it is crucial for investors to look for emerging projects that can lead adoption of the technology, similar to Qtum and VeChain.

title: Ethereum Staking Provider Lido to Incorporate NFTs Into Unstaking Process - CoinDesk
summary: Lido, an Ethereum staking provider, will incorporate NFTs into its unstaking process. Users will have two steps for ether withdrawals: request and claim. A Lido-issued NFT will represent the withdrawal request, which can be used to claim ETH rewards. The NFT will be burned after redemption.

title: Ethereum faces bearish divergence with crypto markets under pressure - crypto.news
summary: Ethereum and bitcoin are facing resistance and bearish divergences, which could lead to short-term declines. Ethereum is experiencing a bearish divergence and is currently testing support between $1,650 and $1,700. If the price breaks below $1,730, it could signal a bearish trend. Bitcoin is facing rejection from a resistance range of $28,000 to $29,500 and could experience a further pullback to the support area between $24,000 and $25,200. The funding rates for all coins across all exchanges have flipped into negative territory, which could lead to more selling pressure.

title: Bitcoin vs Ethereum Price Prediction Experts believe RenQ will give profits - Hindustan Times
summary: RenQ Finance (RENQ) is an altcoin that experts believe has better profit potential than Bitcoin and Ethereum in 2023. RenQ Finance is a DeFi platform that offers institutional-grade liquidity to the DeFi market and has low transaction fees. While Bitcoin and Ethereum have faced price fluctuations, RenQ Finance's innovative features and strong community support make it a promising investment option. However, it's important to do your own research and carefully consider the risks before investing in any cryptocurrency.

title: How ETH holders scrambled for shelter following CFTC’s ‘commodity’ proscription - AMBCrypto News
summary: Ethereum (ETH) holders are moving their assets off exchanges and into self-custody due to regulatory uncertainty. The number of ETH held in self-custody has reached an all-time high of 101.18 million, despite a slight drop in network growth. The CFTC has classified ETH as a commodity, while the SEC views it as a security, creating confusion and skepticism among investors. However, the number of active addresses on the Ethereum network has increased, indicating more transactions and user traction. The Shanghai upgrade is also underway, with Prysmatic Labs announcing necessary node and validator operations to ensure the smooth execution of the upgrade.

title: OpenSea sees a slump in Ethereum and Polygon NFT sales; Details inside - AMBCrypto News
summary: OpenSea, a leading NFT marketplace, has seen a decline in Ethereum and Polygon-based NFT sales. Q1 sales figures are on track to be the lowest yet, with a 50% decline in Ethereum-based NFT sales and a 97% drop in Polygon-based NFT sales compared to the previous month. OpenSea's market share has also declined significantly since the beginning of the year, with a 98% drop in the count of unique active wallets and a 99% decline in transactions. The launch of Blur, a new NFT marketplace and aggregator, has gained significant traction and led to a surge in Blur's NFT transfer volume, while OpenSea's market share has decreased.

title: Why Zero-Knowledge Proofs Are Critical to Ethereum's Future - Unchained - Unchained
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Zero-knowledge proofs are crucial for Ethereum's future, according to Stanford cryptography professor Dan Boneh and a16z General Partner Ali Yahya. They explain the importance of succinct proof systems, the differences between SNARKs and STARKs, and why centralization cannot be fully avoided. The pair also discusses the applications of zero-knowledge technology, including off-chain computations and zkEVMs, and the challenges of trusted setups. They also touch on the topic of privacy and how it can be achieved in various areas, including financial transactions, social networks, and gaming. Finally, they discuss the potential for privacy-focused technologies to be compliant with regulations.

title: For the First Time Since 2015: Nearly 90% of The ETH Supply Now in Self Custody - CryptoPotato
summary: Nearly 90% of Ethereum's supply is now stored in self-custody addresses, the highest figure since 2015, according to Santiment. This comes as investors lose faith in centralized exchanges, with withdrawals from Binance soaring after the CFTC threatened to sue the platform. Only 10.31% of Ethereum's supply is now held on exchanges, the lowest ratio since the token's birth. Investors are moving their holdings to cold wallets, with Binance experiencing $400 million in net outflows in the past 24 hours. This follows a similar trend in November during the FTX meltdown, which undermined trust in centralized platforms.

title: Crypto News: Bitcoin and Ethereum push resistance levels; New Crypto Dogetti Aims for Meme Coin Throne. - Analytics Insight
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Crypto news: Bitcoin and Ethereum push resistance levels, while new crypto Dogetti aims for meme coin throne.

Bitcoin:

* Climbed back from slump after Fed's rate hike
* Resilience and upward momentum despite rate hikes
* Decentralized architecture and lack of single power center attract investors
* Long-term prospects strong due to rise of DeFi

Ethereum:

* Pushing $1800 resistance level
* Growing popularity of DeFi applications contributes to rally
* Long-term investment credentials remain strong despite volatility

Dogetti:

* Newest entrant to crypto world with goal of becoming top meme coin
* Community-focused token with unique features like buy-back protocol and NFTs
* Aims to create generational wealth for community members through decentralized ecosystem
* Based on Ethereum blockchain with total supply of 100 billion tokens.

title: Crypto Price Today: Bitcoin holds above $27,000; BNB, Litecoin down 5% - The Economic Times
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin held above $27,000, but other top crypto tokens declined. BNB, Litecoin, and Dogecoin were among the top losers. The market cap of Bitcoin was around $523.24 billion, with a dominance of 46.10%. The total volume in DeFi was $3.82 billion, and the volume of all stablecoins was $39.06 billion. Ripple surged over 7%, while XRP proponents showed confidence that it will not be declared a security by the courts. The experts gave mixed predictions for Bitcoin's future price, with some expecting it to drop to $22,609 and others predicting a move up to $30,000.

title: Ethereum Supply On Exchanges Plunges To New All-Time Lows - Bitcoinist
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum supply on exchanges has reached a new all-time low of 10.3%, according to Santiment. This indicates that holders are removing their coins from centralized exchanges and holding them in personal wallets. The trend is bullish for the asset, suggesting high confidence from HODLers. The Ethereum price is consolidating recently, trading around $1,700 with a 1% decrease in the last week.

title: ETH struggles to break out of $1,800 ahead of the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade – Will this increase buying pressure? - Crypto News Flash
summary: Ethereum (ETH) is struggling to break above $1,800 ahead of the Shanghai upgrade, with some selling pressure observed over the weekend. Despite this, large Ethereum whale addresses have been buying up ETH, and retail investors are also accumulating the cryptocurrency. The Shanghai upgrade is expected to unlock staked ETH, which could increase buying pressure. However, the report by Bank of America suggests that ETH usage may drop if the network's speed doesn't improve soon. The total value locked in the ETH 2.0 deposit contract has reached a new high, indicating a bullish scenario for ETH. Despite ETH's advancements this year, it has struggled to keep up with Bitcoin's gains.

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Enabled In Burger King Paris: Details - TronWeekly
summary: Burger King has partnered with crypto payment providers Alchemy Pay and Binance Pay to accept cryptocurrency payments at its Paris outlet. The move marks a significant step forward for the acceptance of cryptocurrency for real-world goods and services. The installation of market-leading Instpower power bank rental machines, which take cryptocurrency payments, has been made possible through the collaboration between Instpower, Alchemy Pay, and Binance Pay. This development follows Burger King's previous experiments with cryptocurrency payments in 2017 and 2021. The inclusion of cryptocurrency payments at Burger King's Paris outlet is expected to boost the use cases of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies within the restaurant industry.

title: Polygon Launches zkEVM to Scale Ethereum - Techgenyz
summary: Polygon launches zkEVM to scale Ethereum, allowing for seamless transfer of assets and data between the two networks. Polygon Hermes will also provide a bridge to the Ethereum main net for easy transfer. (235 tokens)
